sense.name: wish, want, or perfer to do something
sense.commentary: Note: Usually appears in a semi-modal form of: X verb[MODAL] LIKE TO-verb
sense.examples: If you'd like to read a similar version in your own language, click here. I should like my beer warm, thank you. Would you like a glass of wine with your dinner? I'd like to go swimming this afternoon. We'd also like to send out a big thanks to everyone who came out to the shows!

sense.name: enjoy, be fond of or approve
sense.examples: I like my beer warm. She likes to read Russian novels. I really like my new hairdo. I don't like upsetting people. How did you like the President's speech last night?
